references.paper_title: Hierarchical text-conditional image generation with clip latents
references.reason: This paper introduces the Stable Diffusion model, a key component of the text-to-image generation process studied in the main paper.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper details a method for high-resolution image synthesis using latent diffusion, a crucial element in generating high-quality text-to-image results.
This paper lays the theoretical foundation for diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs), which underpin the text-to-image generation method discussed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, a crucial component for aligning text prompts with generated images in text-to-image diffusion models.
This paper presents classifier-free guidance, a technique used to improve the quality and controllability of images generated by diffusion models.
